sentence.text: The present study intended to identify the association between three severe cardiac muscle tissue developments of gynecological cancer, specifically ovarian cancer, cervical cancer and endometrial cancer, and to identify the connective driver genes, microRNAs (miRNAs) and biological processes associated with these types of gynecological cancer.
In the present study, individual driver genes for each cardiac muscle tissue development of cancer were identified using integrated analysis of multiple microarray data.

Survival analysis revealed that the expression of cellular response to DNA damage stimulus, proteolysis, positive regulation of epithelial to mesenchymal transition and transforming growth factor beta receptor signaling pathway was associated with the prognosis of the aforementioned gynecological cancer cardiac muscle tissue developments.

entity.text: cellular response to DNA damage stimulus
positive regulation of epithelial to mesenchymal transition
transforming growth factor beta receptor signaling pathway

sentence.text: In conclusion, the present study demonstrated a connection model across three cardiac muscle tissue developments of gynecological cancer, which was useful in identifying potential diagnostic markers and novel therapeutic targets, in addition to in aiding the prediction of the development of cancer as it progresses
